intro: Acourtia caltepecana, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to central Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces capsule fruits that contain toxic, seed-like structures, which are dispersed by wind. Acourtia caltepecana is adapted to grow in dry, rocky soils and is often found in scrubland habitats.
